results.title: Efficacy and safety of the metformin-mazindol anorectic combination in rat.
results.text_hl: Theoretical effective dose 40 (ED40t) did not differ from the experimental effective dose 40 (ED40e) obtained with the @CHEMICAL_Mazindol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008454 @@@mazindol@@@-@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ mixture in the @<m>DISEASE_Anorexia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000855 @@@anorexia@@@ experiments, by Student's t-test.

citations.NLM: Argüelles-Tello F, Roa-Coria JE, Zúñiga-Romero Á, Huerta-Cruz JC, Quiñonez-Bastidas GN, Flores-Murrieta FJ, Rocha-González HI, Reyes-García JG. Efficacy and safety of the metformin-mazindol anorectic combination in rat. Acta Pharm. 2021 Jun 1;71(2):279-291. PMID: 33151165

results.title: The GDF15-GFRAL pathway is dispensable for the effects of metformin on energy balance.
results.text_hl: The data presented here question whether @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ is a sufficiently strong stimulator of @GENE_GDF15 @GENE_9518 @@@GDF15@@@ to drive @<m>DISEASE_Anorexia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000855 @@@anorexia@@@ and @DISEASE_Weight_Loss @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@weight loss@@@ and emphasize that additional work is needed to untangle the relationship among @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @GENE_GDF15 @GENE_9518 @@@GDF15@@@, and energy balance.

citations.NLM: Klein AB, Nicolaisen TS, Johann K, Fritzen AM, Mathiesen CV, Gil C, Pilmark NS, Karstoft K, Blond MB, Quist JS, Seeley RJ, Færch K, Lund J, Kleinert M, Clemmensen C. The GDF15-GFRAL pathway is dispensable for the effects of metformin on energy balance. Cell Rep. 2022 Aug 23;40(8):111258. PMID: 36001956

results.title: Comparison of gastrointestinal adverse events with different doses of metformin in the treatment of elderly people with type 2 diabetes.
results.text_hl: METHODS: A total of 361 elderly @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with newly diagnosed @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@ were randomly divided into three groups: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ 1000 mg/d (N = 120), @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ 1500 mg/d (N = 121) and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ 2000 mg/d (N = 120).

citations.NLM: Yuxin H, Cuiping J, Wen T, Jieyuzhen Q, Xiaoming T, Qin G, Haidong W, Jiao S, Zhijun B. Comparison of gastrointestinal adverse events with different doses of metformin in the treatment of elderly people with type 2 diabetes. J Clin Pharm Ther. 2020 Jun;45(3):470-476. PMID: 31769886

results.title: A phase I study of temsirolimus in combination with metformin in patients with advanced or recurrent endometrial cancer.
results.text_hl: In addition to inducing metabolic changes in cells, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ activates @GENE_PRKAA2 @GENE_5563 @@@AMPK@@@, which in turn inhibits the @GENE_MTOR @GENE_2475 @@@mTOR@@@ pathway.

results.title: Management of type 2 diabetes mellitus in older adults: eight case studies with focus SGLT-2 inhibitors and metformin.
results.text_hl: We aimed to outline our experience with three oldest-old @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with high cardiovascular risk managed with SGLT-2 inhibitors, and five @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Anorexia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000855 @@@anorexia@@@/@DISEASE_Weight_Loss @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@weight loss@@@ managed by @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ cessation.

results.title: [Cross-Sectional Study on Adverse Effects of Metformin Hydrochloride on 130 Patients Type 2 Diabetic Admitted to Medical Center and Diabetes Home of Sidi Bel-Abbes].
results.text_hl: Five (3.85%) @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ had a total and lasting intolerance to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MetforminHydrochloride@@@ leading to its discontinuation following persistent @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhoea@@@.

results.title: A Case of Diabetic Ketoacidosis in a Patient on an SGLT2 Inhibitor and a Ketogenic Diet: A Critical Trio Not to Be Missed
results.text_hl: A 47-year-old male with a history of poorly controlled T2DM on @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_empagliflozin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C570240 @@@empagliflozin@@@ presented to the emergency department (ED) with several days of @DISEASE_Pharyngitis @DISEASE_MESH:D010612 @@@pharyngitis@@@, @DISEASE_Dyspnea @DISEASE_MESH:D004417 @@@dyspnea@@@, @DISEASE_Vomiting @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@emesis@@@, @DISEASE_Abdominal_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D015746 @@@abdominal pain@@@, and @<m>DISEASE_Anorexia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000855 @@@anorexia@@@.

citations.NLM: Steinmetz-Wood S, Gilbert M, Menson K. A Case of Diabetic Ketoacidosis in a Patient on an SGLT2 Inhibitor and a Ketogenic Diet: A Critical Trio Not to Be Missed Case Rep Endocrinol. 2020;2020():8832833. PMID: 32855828
